p: Sand temperatures at all logger locations exhibited temporal and spatial variation at Bahía de Jiquilisco (2012–2015) and Estero Padre Ramos (2015). At Bahía de Jiquilisco, temperatures steadily decreased by 1–2°C over the hawksbill nesting season at 30‐ and 60‐cm sand depths from April through October in beach zones and deforested areas, and from May through October in hatcheries (Figure 4a,c). Beach and hatchery sand temperatures at Estero Padre Ramos decreased from 33°C to 29°C in June, rose to near‐initial levels during July through August, and then decreased by 1–2°C from September through October (Figure 4b,d).
